results.title: Ibrahim
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Material Production Curriculum Branch Education Dept of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film has been made to provoke discussion of issues about racial prejudice. It tells the story of Ibrahim, a twelve-year-old Lebanese boy, who comes to Melbourne from war-torn Beirut. He goes straight into a post-primary school knowing no English and haunted by the horrors he has seen. Cast includes Sherif Abada. Based on a story by Jane Watson. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Job Interview
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: A depressed job-seeker is frustrated in his attempts to obtain work. His fairy-job mother encourages him to consider his positive attributes and apply them in his interviews. Features Graeme Blundell Julie McGregor.

results.title: Media Education (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Children must learn to evaluate and understand the language of media forms. By actively participating in media studies classes, film making, role playing and newscasting, they learn to question what they see and read, and become more aware of good and bad production

results.title: Kampuchea after Pol Pot
results.creator_credit: Mark Stiles, Mary Leggett and Australian Freedom From Hunger Campaign
results.brief_description: Shows the Kampuchean people’s will to survive and the progress they have made in rebuilding their shattered lives. Traces the operations of the Freedom from Hunger Campaign and the obstacles placed in the way by international politics. Narrated by Don Dunstan.

results.title: Home on the range: U.S. bases in Australia
results.creator_credit: Gil Scrine and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Examines the existence of U.S. military bases in Australia and how their presence has affected its position in the nuclear arms race between the Soviet Union and America. Considers the question of nuclear arms in Australia in terms of the presence of the C.I.A. in Australia, its manipulation on the course of Australia’s political affairs and the mounting opposition by the general public. Script: Gil Scrine, Bob Connolly, David Bradbury Narrated by Annie Webster, David Ritchie

results.title: Just Part Of the Job
results.creator_credit: Evan Keddie, Kim Windsor and Victorian Unemployed Workers' Union
results.brief_description: Designed to stimulate discussion regarding sexual harassment. Shows a school leaver and her efforts to find a job. Presents the difficult situation she finds herself in when she is subject to a rather subtle form of sexual harassment in an employment interview.

results.title: Neon
results.creator_credit: Salik Silverstein, Alex Proyas and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A single-frame time-lapse journey through Sydney, the surrealistic city. Figures dart in and out of the shadows of the night. A kaleidoscope of imagery flies by - incorporates people in subways, cars on freeways, city streets and buildings. The music (by Fad Gadget) drives the images to a tumultuous climax.

results.title: Headstart for Omar
results.creator_credit: Myrtle Winter-Chaumeny, United Nations Television and United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East
results.brief_description: Omar was a boy when he fled with his parents from the family orange grove near Jaffa and joined 750,000 Palastinian Arab refugees streaming out of the new State of Israel. Ever since then Omar has waited and now lives in Qatar, where he works and bides his time. Like others of 1948, Omar waits for the world community to settle a long overdue account.
